title: Welcome!
text: I am a Researcher with the MaineHealth Center for Interdisciplinary Population and Health Research (CIPHR). I recently earned a Population Health Ph.D. from Northeastern University. My research focuses on improving care for people with cystic fibrosis through the use of real-world data.

title: Welcome!
text:
Research Interests

Mathematical models for complex systems
Stochastic modeling
Disease dynamics

title: Welcome!
text:
Personal Interests

Mountain adventures (skiing, hiking)
Science fiction reading
Medical TV dramas

title: Welcome!
text:
Recent News

September 2024: Started as a Postdoctoral Researcher with the Computational Medicine research group at the Roux Institute at Northeastern University in Portland, ME.
March 2025: Successfully [defended] my dissertation, Embracing Change: Social Determinants, Service Delivery, and Health Outcomes in Cystic Fibrosis.

title: About
text:
I am a Vermonter through and through. I grew up in Northern Vermont and got my Bachelor of Science in Mathematics at Saint Michael’s College. After graduating, I jumped right into my graduate studies at the University of Vermont in the Mathematical Science Ph.D. program and the Vermont Complex Systems Center.

When I am not at my laptop or reading papers, you can find me either in the mountains, where I am hiking or skiing, or at a Crossfit class.
